item.title: Beogram 4000: Adjusting the AC Motor Voltage
item.description:
During my Beogram 4000 turntable restoration, I observed a noisy motor, especially at 45 RPM. Replacing the electrolytic capacitors helped but didn’t solve the problem completely. To investigate further, I examined the motor voltage and the signal waveform from the Wien bridge oscillator, a clever design that uses an incandescent light bulb as a variable resistor for amplitude control. I measured the AC waveform amplitude at one of the motor leads relative to ground...

item.title: Beogram 4000: Adjusting the AC Motor Voltage and Measuring the Voltage Differences Between the Phases
item.description:
During the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, the AC motor requires precise adjustment. The service manual recommends setting the main phase voltage to 6V (RMS) and the frequency to 42.3 Hz for 33 RPM using an oscilloscope. To observe both motor phases, connect the oscilloscope probes across the phase capacitor. Begin the adjustment by setting the 33 RPM trimmer on the control panel to its neutral position.
